meanings.definition: A person who channels or transmits messages from a spiritual source.
meanings.sent1: The channelers at the gathering shared messages from the spirits with the attendees.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe that channelers have a special connection to the spiritual realm.
meanings.sent3: The channelers joked that their messages from the spirits were like receiving texts from the afterlife.
meanings.sent4: The channelers' ability to relay messages from the spiritual world is like being a telephone line to the divine.
meanings.sent5: The channelers' voices echoed with the wisdom of the spirits, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that directs or controls the flow of something.
meanings.sent1: The irrigation system had various channelers to guide the water to different fields.
meanings.sent2: The channelers in the factory ensured the smooth flow of materials along the production line.
meanings.sent3: The channelers in the river were like traffic lights for the water.
meanings.sent4: The channelers in the dam controlled the release of water, preventing floods downstream.
meanings.sent5: The channelers in the air conditioning system regulated the airflow throughout the building.

meanings.sent1: The local channelers broadcasted the news to the entire town.
meanings.sent2: Many people tuned in to the channelers to listen to their favorite programs.
meanings.sent3: The channelers on the radio station joked about the weather forecast mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The channelers on TV illuminated the living rooms with their colorful shows.
meanings.sent5: The channelers on the radio waves carried music and stories to listeners far and wide.
